name: molly conger
tweet: a relatively short agenda tonight for the charlottesville city council meeting. the 4pm pre-meeting meeting was canceled.  the full agenda packet is here:  https://t.co/iXyb8vA3Ia  https://t.co/9G5sVgT6vr

name: molly conger
tweet: there's really no use speculating what the "legal consultation" is in the closed session, but i wonder if that personnel discussion has anything to do with the police civilian review board? they're getting close to hiring an executive director.

name: molly conger
tweet: i guess either the legal consultation or personnel discussion could have something to do with this very bizarre development at the last PCRB meeting - the PCRB chair going to bat for cops who hate the police chief   https://t.co/LknerVgJsu

name: molly conger
tweet: during public comment at the last meeting, we heard from several people about interest among transit operators for a union. included in tonight's packet was this march 6 email from the president of the charlottesville professional firefighters assoc.   https://t.co/R2V2AURjXv  https://t.co/cMepcJNUHJ

name: molly conger
tweet: the last item on tonight's agenda is a recommendation from the city manager that council reject the proposed collective bargaining ordinance put forward by the fire dept & ask the city manager to develop an ordinance for presentation next month.  https://t.co/ZEMZtV4W5h

name: molly conger
tweet: based on this comment from the last meeting, i anticipate mayor walker will be unenthusiastic about allowing city employees to unionize, but i hope to be proven wrong.   https://t.co/aDyvMO0sdn

name: molly conger
tweet: and on the consent agenda tonight, a long overdue edit to the city code to remove gendered language, something i thought we did in 2019?? but that may have just been the city charter, not the entire code   https://t.co/Wh6ZTzVhOY  https://t.co/PJ1gWUVPx4

name: molly conger
tweet: the closed session is going long... still waiting on the meeting to start 👀

name: molly conger
tweet: more than 20 minutes late, the regular meeting has been called to order & it looks like we have some officers on the call 👀  https://t.co/eZ4zlNVpAQ

name: molly conger
tweet: dr denise bonds, the director of the blue ridge health district, is here tonight to give an update on the pandemic situation locally.

name: molly conger
tweet: local COVID cases had completely flattened out, damn near to zero, but in the last week or two, we're starting to see new cases. dr bonds says we're seeing mainly delta variant cases.  https://t.co/FTrWecXZvM

name: molly conger
tweet: dr bonds cites the recent example of the covid outbreak in provincetown, MA - it was a highly vaxxed population, but a large public gathering still caused an outbreak. the good news is: vaccination protected people from severe illness, hospitalization, & death.

name: molly conger
tweet: the delta variant is extremely contagious & spread is still possible among vaccinated people! get vaxxed because it DOES protect you, but it isn't the only thing you should do. masks are still recommended indoors & when distancing isn't possible  https://t.co/mjQYNqTkgI

name: molly conger
tweet: "vaccines are our way out of this pandemic," dr bonds says. get vaccinated! spread creates variants. stop the spread to stop new variants.  https://t.co/FmhyBkqU6s

name: molly conger
tweet: *regardless of vaccination status* ***EVERYONE*** entering a k-12 school in virginia must wear a mask!  https://t.co/BGzLVtHVTE

name: molly conger
tweet: honestly i expected better of charlottesville. we're vaxxed at slightly BELOW the state average.  https://t.co/2L1PmuwiEY

name: molly conger
tweet: as was announced at the BRHD press conference earlier this afternoon, immunocompromised people can now get a 3rd covid vaccine. dr bonds recommends talking to the doctor treating you for your underlying condition about whether this is right for you.   https://t.co/Y09DnhnM6M

name: molly conger
tweet: in the blue ridge health district, people in their 20s are the least likely to be vaccinated and most likely to get covid! people in their 20s ARE AT RISK from covid, regardless of their feelings of invincibility  https://t.co/FqxUgl3voI

name: molly conger
tweet: this shows vax rates by census tract. the low rate for UVA is likely because UVA students use their home addresses (UVA is requiring the vax)  https://t.co/yZSRaHGu4e

name: molly conger
tweet: the JPA tract vax rate is likely partially due to students (again, they often use their parents' address), but the 10th & page neighborhood is not as densely populated by students & is likely actually representative of low vax uptake  https://t.co/gZIl69OzBk

name: molly conger
tweet: teletha howard is a health dept outreach worker who has been talking to people in the community about the vaccine. people who aren't able to or comfortable with going to a vax site can get the vaccine in their own home.  https://t.co/GL7CSWKLU6

name: molly conger
tweet: local testing capacity is ramping back up after having tapered off a bit as cases decreased. you can always check their website for more info on getting tested -  https://t.co/Hte73oPsPf  https://t.co/wH35hsEYjY

name: molly conger
tweet: the health department is here to help! you can call for answers in english or spanish.  https://t.co/lhHLpU9qii

name: molly conger
tweet: did someone sedate city council? they seem a little off.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker notes that not all masks are created equal - if they have to wear masks, why isn't there specific guidance on what KIND of mask they have to wear?

name: molly conger
tweet: "you're always better wearing any mask than no mask," says dr bonds, saying the state likely didn't want to impose additional barriers by mandating specific kinds of masks.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker says the better masks out there are more expensive - if we are interested in using masks to reduce spread in schools, schools should be providing masks that can do that.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker also cautions against "treating the vaccine hesitant as the vaccine hostile," which she says pushes those people further away from being interested in getting the vaccine.

name: molly conger
tweet: teletha howard, the outreach worker, says she was a little hesitant herself! she had conversations with healthcare workers & doctors to help her decide to get the vaccine. she shares her story with other people who are vaccine hesitant & talks to them without judgment.

name: molly conger
tweet: even if you are young & otherwise healthy, if you contract covid & start to feel short of breath, you should seek medical attention, says dr bonds. it can go bad quickly, she says.

name: molly conger
tweet: dr bonds says you can get a vaccine from the health department without any kind of documentation of any kind. providing incentives (gift cards, etc) would require that to change, which is why she's hesitant to do that.

name: molly conger
tweet: i've developed a strange sort of parasocial relationship with the employees of my local health department. i trust them and i hope they are happy and healthy.

name: molly conger
tweet: wow huge news in the announcements section: the city of charlottesville got an award for achievement of excellence in financial reporting. very exciting stuff!  https://t.co/hJZSGrG9T8

name: molly conger
tweet: no takers for public comment on consent agenda items. lloyd snook has some individual line edits for item 4 (a simple ctrl+F for words like 'man' doesn't neatly solve the problem, things like "man made" shouldn't become "individual made" etc)  https://t.co/DCzVgW8oXm

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker asks if there's a reason why the nonprofit in question is not named in item 3 & if the tax mistake is the business' fault, does the city still have to pay them back? todd divers says there are rules about divulging taxpayer information.

name: molly conger
tweet: divers says he did put the business' name on the documentation last time this happened, "and i probably shouldn't have" because giving specific figures about taxes paid verges on divulging protected taxpayer info (i assume he means the silverchair refund)   https://t.co/iwxOXIAqmB

name: molly conger
tweet: again, as with the silverchair situation: regardless of whose mistake it was, the city has to pay interest on overpayment of business license tax. "it's dumb," divers concedes, but it is the law.

name: molly conger
tweet: the consent agenda carries 5-0. for city manager's response to matters by the public, city manager chip boyles says he has nothing new to report.  on to public comment - 4 people have pre-registered, leaving 12 open spots.

name: molly conger
tweet: marta keane, the CEO at the jefferson area board for aging, reads some figured from their recent survey - she's referring to a report i can't see, but it sounds like both seniors & volunteers seem satisfied.

name: molly conger
tweet: deonte johnson says the city provides only 1 early voting site, which is downtown. placing another early voting site near UVA grounds would increase accessibility for students to vote.

name: molly conger
tweet: this is a good idea and the city should do it. i waited in line for HOURS to vote early at the downtown early voting location. tens of thousands of UVA students and employees would probably love having a more convenient place to vote early in person.

name: molly conger
tweet: vice mayor sena magill raises the issue that UVA dorms are in the county, so wouldn't the county be the one to set this up?  (it's true that all the dorms & most UVA buildings are in the county, but most UVA students living off grounds are city residents)

name: molly conger
tweet: chair of the human rights commission, mary bauer, reads a statement from the commission on the anniversary of august 12, 2017 & reaffirms their commitment to equity & racial justice.

name: molly conger
tweet: (speaking of human rights - the captions & transcript functions that zoom has are turned off for this particular meeting! i had really been enjoying those accessibility features)

name: molly conger
tweet: mary pettis has been driving a bus in charlottesville for 35 years. she called in tonight to ask council to allow bus drivers to unionize.

name: molly conger
tweet: "i love driving, i love my passengers, i just need more from it financially," pettis says, urging council to allow transit operators to unionize.

name: molly conger
tweet: "i personally had to move from charlottesville to waynesboro because i couldn't afford to live in charlottesville. i have 3 jobs because i don't make enough money just driving a bus," pettis says.

name: molly conger
tweet: "it shouldn't take collective bargaining," mayor walker says. walker says she "fully supports" it, but it shouldn't be necessary, that the city should be meeting these needs already.

name: molly conger
tweet: marcia geyer says the city manager should work with the school board to determine how many masks are needed in the schools & charitable donations of $ and masks should be collected & provided to students.

name: molly conger
tweet: tanesha hudson called from what sounded like a party or a restaurant to say in-person meetings should resume. earlier in the summer, the city had been aiming for september for this, but it has obviously been pushed back due to widespread community transmission of COVID.

name: molly conger
tweet: charles neer is still very concerned about parking at the proposed 8 unit apartment building at 1206 carlton   https://t.co/vkvp6NlHPX

name: molly conger
tweet: ms katrina turner has called in to discuss the alleged morale problems within the police department. she asks if the city will believe there are problems with the leadership at CPD now that police are saying it, when community members have been saying it.   https://t.co/2iyScv0cRH

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker says the community is "easily manipulated" and "this is an example of that."  she does not elaborate on what this means.

name: molly conger
tweet: greg wright of the fire dept has called in to voice support for collective bargaining for all city employees. he agrees that "it should not have to come to this" but all city employees deserve to have a seat at the table.

name: molly conger
tweet: ok, that concludes public comment. we'll recess for 15 minutes & then get on to the rest of the agenda  https://t.co/hghelVml8x

name: molly conger
tweet: the city council halftime show  https://t.co/HqI4VYOAhS

name: molly conger
tweet: they're legally required to hold public hearings on vacating easements, but it's never anything particularly interesting  https://t.co/C1dM5Rc7Y5

name: molly conger
tweet: ok the 2nd reading was waived & the 3 gas easements have been vacated. no public comment or discussion on that one. now on to the oddly contentious 1206 carlton ave rezoning & SUP  https://t.co/9HyaqBANd4

name: molly conger
tweet: we've got a sneak preview on at least 2 of the 5 votes from an accidental motion made at the last meeting (payne yes, walker no)  https://t.co/TQqdjQdGyA

name: molly conger
tweet: vice mayor sena magill moves to approve the rezoning. lloyd snook seconds the motion (clarifying that this is separate from the SUP, but the SUP is contingent on the rezoning passing) the rezoning of 1206 carlton ave carries 4-1, with mayor walker voting no.

name: molly conger
tweet: lloyd snook moves to approve the SUP, payne seconds. mayor walker again votes no, with heather hill joining her in voting no this time, but the special use permit for the now-rezoned 1206 carlton ave passes 3-2.

name: molly conger
tweet: on to the final agenda item - collective bargaining for city employees!   https://t.co/5cIGcutp6N

name: molly conger
tweet: city manager chip boyles cites the example of other localities in VA who are embarking on complicated journeys (involving outside consultants and long timelines) toward collective bargaining

name: molly conger
tweet: boyles says the city doesn't at this time have sufficient information to make a good decision on a collective bargaining ordinance & council should reject the ordinance put forward on behalf of the firefighters.  https://t.co/ApJfYyr4tu

name: molly conger
tweet: boyles' recommendation to council is to vote down the firefighters' proposal but pass a resolution asking him (the city manager) to develop a collective bargaining ordinance for the city.

name: molly conger
tweet: vice mayor sena magill voices support for the idea of collective bargaining. lloyd snook says he wants to make sure people understand that loudoun & alexandria got started on this "almost right after the statute was passed last year... and we did not."

name: molly conger
tweet: snook adds that the city didn't even have a city attorney at the time this law changed last year. he wants greg wright & the fire dept to know their letter isn't being ignored & hopes the city will be able to move forward "with reasonable dispatch"

name: molly conger
tweet: payne agrees that it's the correct decision to take the time to get this right, but cautions against letting it get delayed past the current budget cycle or let it languish indefinitely.

name: molly conger
tweet: lol i forgot the city still doesn't have an HR director. that does complicate a wide variety of things!

name: molly conger
tweet: council voted unanimously voted to not approve the collective bargaining ordinance put forward on behalf of the fire dept and unanimously in favor of having the city manager develop a collective bargaining ordinance for the city.

name: molly conger
tweet: boyles says the posting for the HR director closed on friday, so they will be able to start trying to hire an applicant. with no other business, we are on to closing matters by the public... and with no takers... we are adjourned in under 3 hours!

name: molly conger
tweet: it's very weird to me no one felt it was necessary to discuss that the police civilian review board has gone fully off the rails and is now allying with the police benevolent association to try to oust the police chief, but whatever i guess.
